records.location_details: Bulgarian border with Turkey (JO Terra 2022, [redacted] operational area), BGR-TUR border, shallow areas of the river.

records.context_note: Allegations of systematic so-called pushbacks and excessive use of force by Bulgarian authorities, based on informal conversations with 10 Bulgarian Border Guard Officers. No personal witnessing by the reporting person. Allegations denied by Bulgarian authorities but considered relatively credible by FRO due to consistency with other reports.
records.evidence_quote: A Frontex Standing Corps Officer deployed to the Bulgarian border with Turkey (JO Terra 2022, [redacted] operational area) submitted a report containing allegations of systematic so-called pushbacks and the excessive use of force by Bulgarian authorities.

records.location_details: Place: BCP [redacted] JO Terra 2022 Operation area; [redacted] local time, Sensitive operational information. During border checks procedures, [redacted] missing person - is discovered by Bulgarian officers with regards to the child.
records.where_clear: A Border Crossing Point (BCP) in the operational area of JO Terra 2022, Bulgaria.
records.location_text_raw: Place: BCP [redacted] JO Terra 2022 Operation area, Bulgaria

possible_violations.legal_basis: Article 24, Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union

possible_violations.violation_name: obligation to ensure primary consideration of best interests of the child
right to respect for private and family life
possible_violations.legal_basis: Article 8, European Convention on Human Rights

records.context_note: Incident involving a father and child at a BCP in Bulgaria. Flawed assessment of the child's best interests by Bulgarian border guards, leading to the child's interests not being safeguarded and the father escaping with the child.
records.evidence_quote: As regards the case scrutinised under SIR 11009/2022, the Fundamental Rights Office found that a flawed assessment of best interests of a child reported missing by Bulgarian border guards...

records.location_details: in a forest in Bulgaria after crossing irregularly the Turkey-Bulgaria border. Refuge in the forest. Bodies found and taken to a hospital in Burgas. Operational area.
records.where_clear: A forest in Bulgaria, near the Turkey-Bulgaria border, within the JO Terra 2022 operational area.
records.location_text_raw: in a forest in Bulgaria after crossing irregularly the Turkey-Bulgaria border, refuge in the forest, Turkey-Bulgaria border, Burgas
records.uncertainty_note: Specific forest location is not provided, only general area near the border.

possible_violations.violation_name: Right to life - obligation to take steps to prevent avoidable losses of life
possible_violations.legal_basis: art. 2 (1) of the EU Charter of Fundamental Rights
art. 19 (1) of the EU Charter of Fundamental Rights
art. 18 of the EU Charter of Fundamental Rights

records.context_note: A group of 10 migrants crossed the Turkey-Bulgaria border. Two died in a forest due to cold and exhaustion after being told to wait by Bulgarian authorities who never returned. The group was later apprehended and 'pushed back' to Turkey. Bulgarian authorities deny records of the incident.
records.evidence_quote: A group of 10 migrants was arrested [redacted] in a forest in Bulgaria after crossing irregularly the Turkey-Bulgaria border on [redacted]. During the two-day wait, due to cold weather and exhaustion, two migrants ([redacted]) died.

records.location_details: In the early morning hours [redacted] a group of 24 migrants is alleged to have irregularly crossed the border from Turkey to Bulgaria in the vicinity of a Turkish village with reported [redacted] name. BGR-TUR border.
records.where_clear: Near the Turkey-Bulgaria border, in the vicinity of a Turkish village (name redacted).
records.location_text_raw: vicinity of a Turkish village with reported [redacted] name, border from Turkey to Bulgaria, BGR-TUR border
records.geocodable_query: Turkish village near Bulgaria Turkey border

records.context_note: A group of 24 migrants crossed the Turkey-Bulgaria border. Attacked by police/military with a service dog, resulting in severe injuries to at least one migrant. No medical assistance provided. Group rounded up and sent back to Turkey. Bulgarian authorities deny the incident, but FRO finds allegations credible.
records.evidence_quote: In the early morning hours o[redacted] a group of 24 migrants is alleged to have irregularly crossed the border from Turkey to Bulgaria... a dog handler set the service dog on them. Several migrants were bitten by the dog, at least one of them sustained severe injuries [redacted].

records.location_details: Bulgaria after irregularly crossing from Greece [redacted]. Bulgaria-Greece green border. Greek territory. Evros river.
records.where_clear: Bulgaria-Greece green border, near the Evros river, after migrants crossed from Turkey to Greece, then to Bulgaria, then back to Greece.
records.location_text_raw: Bulgaria after irregularly crossing from Greece, Bulgaria-Greece green border, Evros river, Greek territory
records.uncertainty_note: Specific crossing points or locations along the border are not provided.

possible_violations.legal_basis: Article 1 of the EU Charter of Fundamental Rights

possible_violations.violation_name: Prohibition of inhuman and degrading treatment
possible_violations.legal_basis: art. 4 of the EU Charter of Fundamental Rights
art. 19 (1) of the EU Charter of Fundamental Rights

records.context_note: A group of 10 migrants, after crossing from Turkey to Greece, then to Bulgaria, were allegedly apprehended by Bulgarian police, beaten, stripped of clothes/phones, and forcibly returned to Greece. Bulgarian authorities deny the incident. FRO finds allegations credible due to consistency with other reports and detailed testimonies.
records.evidence_quote: A group of ten (10) migrants was detected and apprehended in Bulgaria after irregularly crossing from Greece [redacted]. Some of the migrants declared they were forced to take off their shoes and clothes and that their mobile phones were taken by Bulgarian police officers. Some of the migrants were allegedly beaten with sticks by Bulgarian police officers.
